article.title: Amr_Diab
article.paragraph: Amr Abd El-Basset Abd El-Azeez Diab(lang-arعمرو عبدالباسط عبد العزيز دياب IPA-arzˈʕɑm.ɾe ʕæbdelˈbɑːsetˤ ʕæbdelʕæˈziːz deˈjæːbpron;His common shortened name, Amr Diab, is pronounced inEgyptian ArabicasIPA-arzˈʕɑm.ɾedˈjæːbborn 11 October 1961)cite webhttp://www.imdb.com/name/nm0229018/bioBio[[IMDb]]is anEgyptianpopstar and composer ofPop music. He is widely considered the god father of Mediterranean music and the best selling Middle Eastern artist of all time. He has been awarded theWorld Music AwardsWorld Music Awardfor Best Selling Middle Eastern Artist four times: 1996 for albumNour El Ain, 2001 for albumAkter Wahed, 2007 for albumEl Lilladyand 2013 forEl Leilaalbum. He has also won (Best Egyptian Artist, Best Male Arab Artist and World's Best Arab Male Artist Voted Online) at the World Music Awards 2014.http://amrdiab.net/diab/awards/item/264-wma2014.htmlAmr Diab is the only Middle Eastern artist to have received 7 World Music Awards. He also won The African Music Awards 2009 as Artist Of The Year, Song Of The Year, Video Of The Year And Best Male Act, and won The 2010 African Music Awards as best male act and best artist of North Africa. He is the only African artist to have received 6 African Music Awards in his career. He has had five platinum records:Matkhafiesh(1990),Habiby(1991),Ayyamna(1992),Ya Omrena(1993) andNour El Ain(1997, triple platinum). Diab won Big Apple Music Awards 2009 as Lifetime Achievements Awards and Best Singer of The Year and also won The Global Icon Award, Most Popular Artist and Best Arabic Male Artist in 2014.File:Amr Diab With World Music Awards.jpgthumbnailAmr Diab with His 7 World Music Awards
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Amr Diab was born on October 11, 1961 in Port Said, Egypt into an artistic family. His father, Abdul Basset Diab, worked for the Suez Canal Corporation and was the chairman of Marine Construction & Shipbuilding in the canal. Diab's father played a huge role in igniting the early sparks of musical inspiration towards Diab's early stages in his professional music career. Diab, at the age of six, had his first shot at fame when he sang the Egyptian National Anthem "Bilady, Bilady, Bilady" at the annual July 23 Festival in Port Said. Shocking everyone with his amazing voice and singing talent, he was rewarded with a guitar from the governor of Port Said for his excellence. After being awarded the guitar, Diab saw this as his shot to fame, and continued his life singing and pleasing people with his voice through his teenage years. Diab had earned his bachelor's degree in Arabic Music and graduated at the Cairo Academy of Arts in 1986.
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: Diab entered the musical arena and introduced his first albumYa Tareeain 1983. He followed with several additional albums:Ghanny Men Albak(1984),Hala Hala(1986),Khalseen(1987),Mayyal(1988),Shawa'na(1989) andMatkhafesh(1990). Then came albumsHabibi(1991),Ayyamna(1992) andYa Omrena(1993). He then followed withAwedonyin 1998. He performed duets on this album with Algerian-French based Cheb Khaled (on the song "Alby") and with GreekAngela Dimitriou(on the song "Bahebbak Aktar"). The summer of 2004 witnessed the release of theLeily Neharyalbum.Kammel Kalamakwas released in December 2005 and contains 10 tracks representing a year and half of continuous studio efforts. September 2011 saw the release of his albumBanadeek Taala, produced by Rotana. On February 2011, Amr Diab released his hit single "Masr Allet" (Egypt spoke). In 2012, Diab hosted the firstGoogle HangoutsGoogle Hangoutin the Middle East during his performance in Dubai. On October 2014, Amr Diab released his album "Shoft El Ayam" which topped his last album "El Leila" and again became the best selling album in Egypt in iTunes and Rotana. On July 2015, Amr Diab released the music video from his song "Gamalo" from his album "Shoft El Ayam."
article.heading: Musical Style
article.paragraph: Diab is known as the father of Mediterranean Music.cite webLesswingBryanSounds of the Middle East, Minnesota provide options for listenershttp://www.thedepauw.com/features/sounds-of-the-middle-east-minnesota-provide-options-for-listeners-1.1993168October 2009The DePauw20 December 2009cite webCraneKellyEgyptian superstar Amr Diab is set to rock Dubaihttp://gulfnews.com/arts-entertainment/music/egyptian-superstar-amr-diab-is-set-to-rock-dubai-1.615728April 2010Gulf News24 April 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100426154116/http://gulfnews.com/arts-entertainment/music/egyptian-superstar-amr-diab-is-set-to-rock-dubai-1.61572826 April 2010nocite webMattRossQ&A: Amr Diabhttp://www.rollingstoneme.com/index.php?optionJanuary 2011Rolling Stone Middle East5 January 2011He has created his own style which is often termed "Mediterranean Music" or "Mediterranean Sound", a blend of Western and Egyptian rhythms.cite bookMediterranean mosaic: popular music and global soundsFrishkopfMichaelGoffredoPlastino2003Routledge978-0-415-93656-9145–148Some Meanings of the Spanish Tinge in Contemporary Egyptian Musichttp://www.arts.ualberta.ca/~michaelf/Some%20Meanings%20of%20the%20Spanish%20Tinge.pdf4 June 2009David Cooper and Kevin Dawe refer to his music as "the new breed of Mediterranean music".cite bookThe Mediterranean in music: Critical perspectives, common concerns, cultural differencesCooperDavidKevin Dawe2005Scarecrow Press0-8108-5407-4117According to author Michael Frishkopf, Diab has produced a new concept of Mediterranean music, especially with his international hit, "Nour El Ain".

Amr Diab's "Pan-Mediterranean" style Arabic music fuses touches offlamencoandrawith western pop and traditional Arabic rhythms.Citation neededAugust 2015By 1992, he became the first Arabic artist to start making high-tech music videos.His composition tamally maak was appreciated overseas and the song was copied by Indian music composer Anu Mallik in the 2004 film "Murder".Citation neededAugust 2015
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Diab is an active fitness enthusiast.CNOctober 2015Diab is well known for his intense body building. Diab was married to Shereen Reda, from 19891992, ending in a divorce. They have one daughter, Nour, who became known through the song, "Habibi Ya Nour El Ain." Diab is currently married to Zeina Ashour, with whom he has three children: Abdallah, Kinzy, and Jana.
article.heading: Albums
article.paragraph: "Tamally Maak", meaning "Always with you", is written by Ahmed Ali Moussa and the music for the song was composed by Sherif Tag.[1] Original arrangement was by Tarek Madkour. The very popular video was filmed in Czech Republic and the instrumentation prominently included the classic guitar.MainTamally MaakTamally Ma'ak
article.heading: Wayah(2009)
article.paragraph: The world music award of for the best-selling album in theMiddle East2009,Wayah(With Her) was released for sale on the internet on 27 June; however, the album was leaked online and was downloaded illegally amid complaints of slow download speed on the official site. Diab's fans initiated a massive boycott of the sites with the illegal copies.cite webAmr Diab's album sweeping cassette markethttp://www.musicananet.net/index.php?option30 June 2009Musicananet2 July 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20090704070007/http://www.musicananet.net:80/index.php?option4 July 2009ar

On 18 October 2009 Amr Diab won four 2009 African Music Awards in the following categories: best artist, best album, best vocalist and best song for "Wayah"; Amr Diab had been nominated by the Big Apple Music Awards.Cite webhttp://artonline.tv/Entertainment/newsdetails.aspx?newsIDAmr Diab wins four African Music AwardsKhaled Taha25 October 2009[[Arab Radio and Television Network|ART]]28 October 2009Arabichttp://web.archive.org/web/20091027141453/http://www.artonline.tv/Entertainment/NewsDetails.aspx?newsID27 October 2009no
article.heading: Music videos
article.paragraph: Diab is one of the first singers to popularize music videos in the Arab world and the first Egyptian singer to appear in music videos.
article.heading: Film career
article.paragraph: Diab's fame in the music industry has led him to experiment with other forms of media, such as film. Amr played himself in his first film,El Afareet, which was released in 1989. It also starred Madiha Kamel. His second filmIce Cream in Gleam(Ays Krim fi Glym), in which Diab starred in 1992, was chosen as one of the best five Egyptian musical films by theUCLA School of Theater, Film and Television. The film was featured in the UCLA Film and Television Archive's new program "Music on the Nile: Fifty Years of Egyptian Musical Films" at James Bridges Theater at UCLA on 6, 8 and 10 April 1999. David Chute of theLos Angeles Weeklytermed it "observant" and "a big leap".cite newsDavidChuteIrene G. BehnanAll Singing! All Belly-Dancinghttp://www.laweekly.com/1999-04-08/film-tv/all-singing-all-belly-dancing/2Los Angeles Weekly8 April 19994 June 2009http://web.archive.org/web/20090627134412/http://www.laweekly.com/1999-04-08/film-tv/all-singing-all-belly-dancing/227 June 2009noHis third movie was released in 1993, and was namedDeahk We La'ab(Laughter and Fun). The film premiered in the Egyptian Film Festival in 1993. Amr played alongside international Egyptian movie starOmar Sharif(Lawrence of Arabia (film)Lawrence of Arabia,Doctor Zhivago (film)Doctor Zhivago) andYousra. Overall, Diab did not experience the same level of success in film that he had with his music career. Since 1993, Diab has focused on his singing career.
article.heading: Egyptian Revolution
article.paragraph: During the 2011 uprising, some protesters criticized Diab for staying silent, and for fleeing Egypt for London.cite webEgyptian celebrities face protesters' wrath in post-Mubarak Egypthttp://www.aawsat.net/2011/02/article55247479Asharq al-awsat, 18 February 20117 May 2013However, a few days after former PresidentHosni Mubarakstepped down, Amr Diab composed and sang a memorial song, "Masr A'let" (Egypt Said Its Word),https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jsxyHbWY71sand released it in conjunction with a music video showing pictures of the martyrs who died in the2011 Egyptian revolutionuprising. He also initiated a charity campaign "Masry Begad" ("Real Egyptian"), a social national program aimed at serving and rebuilding Egyptian society. His online radio station Diab FM often presents talks and discussions about what the Diab FM team can offer to the community as well as applying it practically by being present in different sites across Egypt with a new humanitarian project each week.http://diabfm.com/masry-begad
article.heading: Amr Diab in movies
article.paragraph: Amr Diab's songs have appeared in several films, including:

list.listitem: "Wala Ala Baloh" inDivine Intervention (film)Divine Intervention(2002)cite webSoundtracks for Yadon ilaheyyahttp://www.imdb.com/title/tt0274428/soundtrackInternet Movie Database11 June 2009

"Wala Ala Baloh" inThe Dictator (2012 film)The Dictator(2012)
